meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of the Greek letter epsilon.
meanings.sent1: The epsilonic symbol is often used in mathematics.
meanings.sent2: Her handwriting had an epsilonic style, resembling the Greek letter.
meanings.sent3: The epsilonic shape of the clouds made them look like fluffy pillows.
meanings.sent4: The epsilonic curve of the road ahead seemed to stretch endlessly.
meanings.sent5: The epsilonic color of the sky at dusk was a beautiful shade of purple.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a small amount or quantity.
meanings.sent1: She only had an epsilonic amount of sugar left in the jar.
meanings.sent2: The epsilonic raindrops fell lightly on the window pane.
meanings.sent3: His epsilonic patience wore thin as he waited for the bus.
meanings.sent4: The epsilonic whispers of the wind carried secrets through the trees.
meanings.sent5: The epsilonic taste of the soup left her craving more flavor.
